info.description: Creates, Amends and Retrieves Service Automation details
info.title: APIs for Service Automation

post.description: Create new process in system with details such as process identifier , environment, frequency ,stage and operator which runs the process.

parameters.name: processId
parameters.description: Process ID

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: body Payload

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

put.description: Updates process information such as process identifier , environment, frequency ,stage and operator which runs the process in the system

parameters.name: processId
parameters.description: Process ID

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: body Payload

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

get.summary: Retrieves the details of a specific service
get.description: Retrieves the details of a specific service with details of status of the process, identifier for the job, verification job identifier, service control status and the time at which the job started and stopped.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: Provides the id of the service that has to be run.

parameters.name: serverName
parameters.description: Hostname of the Server on which the service will run.

parameters.name: serverStatus
parameters.description: Status of Server  POSSIBLE VALUES: ACTIVE: To set the server as active INACTIVE: To set the server as inactive

parameters.name: workProfileId
parameters.description: Contains the reference to the record in service workload profiles for services.

parameters.name: processStatus
parameters.description: The current process status.   Allowed values: - 0: Ready - 1: Running  - 2: Completed successfully  - 3: On hold or in error

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

post.description: Create new service in system with information such as service identifier, the work profile for the service, the server details on which the service is run including the operator and the service control for the service.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: Provides the id of the service that has to be run.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: body Payload

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

put.summary: Update a service in the system
put.description: Update a service with information such as service identifier, the work profile for the service, the server details on which the service is run including the operator and the service control for the service in the system.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: Provides the id of the service that has to be run.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: body Payload

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

get.description: Retrieves a specific workload profile with details such as identifier ,number of agents and time of all the work profile.

parameters.name: workProfileId
parameters.description: Contains the reference to the record in service workload profiles for services.

parameters.name: agentsRequired
parameters.description: The number of agents required

parameters.name: workProfileTime
parameters.description: Contains the time a multithreaded process takes.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

post.description: Create service work load profile with information such as identifier for work profile, the number of agents when using this work profile and the start time of the work profile.

parameters.name: workProfileId
parameters.description: Contains the reference to the record in service workload profiles for services.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: body Payload

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

put.summary: Update a service work load profile
put.description: Update a service work load profile with information such as identifier for work profile, the number of agents when using this work profile and the start time of the work profile in the system.

parameters.name: workProfileId
parameters.description: Contains the reference to the record in service workload profiles for services.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: body Payload

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of all available services in system.
get.description: Retrieves a list of all available services in system including details of status of the process, identifier for the job, verification job identifier, service control status and the time at which the job started and stopped.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: Provides the id of the service that has to be run.

parameters.name: serverName
parameters.description: Hostname of the Server on which the service will run.

parameters.name: serverStatus
parameters.description: Status of Server  POSSIBLE VALUES: ACTIVE: To set the server as active INACTIVE: To set the server as inactive

parameters.name: workProfileId
parameters.description: Contains the reference to the record in service workload profiles for services.

parameters.name: processStatus
parameters.description: The current process status.   Allowed values: - 0: Ready - 1: Running  - 2: Completed successfully  - 3: On hold or in error

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

get.description: Retrieves a detailed status of the specified service including details such as status, reference of the agent,port identifier , session number and the last contact time of the agent.

parameters.description: Provides the id of the service that has to be run.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

get.description: Retrieves aRetrieves a list of all available executed process times in system with details including the job start end time and elapsed time. the throughput, the status of the job  and the control list details list of all available executed process times in system

get.summary: Retrieves a list of elapsed times for reports generated during close of business processing
get.description: Retrieves a list of elapsed times for reports generated during close of business processing with information such as name of the report process, time taken to process the report and session number details.

parameters.description: Contains the business closure time and date on which the error occurred.

parameters.name: reportName

parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

get.summary: Retrieves any logged error messages for a company during the Close of Business processing
get.description: Retrieves any logged error messages for a company during the Close of Business processing with detailed information on the error message, the date on which the error occurred, whether a fix is required for the error faced, if fix is resolved the date on which fix is resolved etc.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The identifier of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch.

parameters.name: businessClosureDate
parameters.description: Contains the business closure time and date on which the error occurred.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

responseCode.description: The user input to accept/reject the override.

processStage.description: Indicates the close of business stage in which the process is executed. The processes are grouped into four distinct stages. The first character is used to define the stage, which must be one of the following: A: Application D: Start of Day R: Reporting S: System O: Online. The system verifies that all the processes in the previous stage have completed successfully before continuing. The remaining 3 characters are process sequence number. Modifications to the sequence number should adhere to the following guidelines: Range 000 to 099: should not be modified. Range 100 to 899: only the last two digits should be modified. Range 900 - 999: should not be modified. If no sequence number (process dependency) has been appended to the process stage, then this process can be run concurrently within the stage. However if a sequence number (e.g. A009) has been specified then the process can be run only when all other processes with sequence numbers lower than this have completed successfully. Processes with the same sequence number can be run concurrently.

processEnvironment.description: Environment where the process will run. Typically this should be set to 'F'

jobId.description: The job name entered must be an entry on the main program file.

verificationJobId.description: Same as jobID, but functionally it does the verification as to whether a job is completed before the jobID is executed.

jobFrequency.description: Defines the frequency at which the job is processed next.  POSSIBLE VALUES: - D: Every working day.  - Dnn: Every nn'th working day. - W: Weekly every Friday.  - M: Last working day of every month. - Mnn: nn represents the offset added to the first day of every month to arrive at Next Run date. When the resultant date is a holiday, previous Working day is considered. - A: The job is picked on the any ad-hoc date. The next run date has to be updated manually.  - Y: Last working day of the year.  - Ynn: Last working day of the nn'th month.  - Jxxx: Always run with job name xxx.

nextRunDate.description: Specifies bank date on which the job is to be next run

operatorName.description: Contains the operator name to be loaded for reporting jobs during Close of Business

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

uniqueIdentifier.description: The unique identifier/Message Reference of the record created.

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

processStage.description: Indicates the close of business stage in which the process is executed. The processes are grouped into four distinct stages. The first character is used to define the stage, which must be one of the following: A: Application D: Start of Day R: Reporting S: System O: Online. The system verifies that all the processes in the previous stage have completed successfully before continuing. The remaining 3 characters are process sequence number. Modifications to the sequence number should adhere to the following guidelines: Range 000 to 099: should not be modified. Range 100 to 899: only the last two digits should be modified. Range 900 - 999: should not be modified. If no sequence number (process dependency) has been appended to the process stage, then this process can be run concurrently within the stage. However if a sequence number (e.g. A009) has been specified then the process can be run only when all other processes with sequence numbers lower than this have completed successfully. Processes with the same sequence number can be run concurrently.

sessionNo.description: The session number in which agent is running

lastContactTime.description: The Last contact time of agent.

processedJob.description: The total number of records/contracts that was processed.

completed.description: The number of contracts completed processing.

correlationId.description: Unique reference to be used in service execution.

serviceId.description: Provides the id of the service that has to be run.

endTime.description: The time the job was ended.

throughPut.description: The number of records processed per minute.   Calculated as:  keys processed / elapsed time * 60

lastTime.description: The time taken to run the job.  Indicates the time taken to Select the job plus the time difference of Start time and End time.

businessClosureDate.description: Contains the business closure time and date on which the error occurred.

sessionNo.description: The session number in which agent is running

endTime.description: The time the job was ended.

elapsedTime.description: The elapsed time of the report in seconds.

correlationId.description: Unique reference to be used in service execution.

reportName.description: Contains the name of the process that produces the report.

workProfileTime.description: Contains the time a multithreaded process takes.

workProfileId.description: Contains the reference to the record in service workload profiles for services.

businessClosureDate.description: Contains the business closure time and date on which the error occurred.

companyId.description: The identifier of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch.

detailKey.description: The keys to those records that were saved at the time the error was reported.

isFixRequired.description: Indicates if error is considered to be a critical error or not. For Critical Error, the batch control application will not be able to be invoked until this error has been resolved. For a Non Critical Error, the batch control application may be invoked even when this error is unresolved, by overriding it.  Allowed values: - YES: Critical Error - NO: Non Critical Error

dateResolved.description: The date on which error has been resolved.
